Intro

aphla is a python library for accelerator physics commissioning and experiments. It is developed at NSLS-II, BNL. It can take advantages of service oriented architectures developed for NSLS-II projects and all of them could be used for other facilities. e.g. channel finder service, model service and unit conversion service

A simple example which read the current orbit and show the plot

>>> import aphla as ap
>>> ap.machines.init("nsls2v2")
>>> ap.getOrbit(spos=True)

For the power user, you have full control of each PV

Get Started

  • Quick start is for users who have an account on lsasd2.ls.bnl.gov or injdev.nsls2.bnl.gov.
  • Tutorial has more details for the installation and settings
  • Code examples are always helpful for impatient people like me.
  • Get help with the Python built-in functions: help([object]) and dir([object])

The Reference has more details to hack if you found the above list can not provide what you need.
